page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN AYLESBURY
page.content: We did a {traffic} count to find the busiest road in Aylesbury. We took the 6 main roads and counted how much traffic past in one hour. The Bicester Road, to our suprise, came first with more vehicles than any other road. This is probably because many were going to the new Tescos. Also, there were more lorries. Wendover Road had the next most number of vehicles because most were going to London. The Tring Road, which also heads towards London, came next with 1,410 vehicles. The Oxford Road was the next in line with 1,047 altogether. The Buckingham Road was the road with the least traffic. The {railway station} has a direct route to London's Marylebone. 20 trains stop at the station daily. There are 8 {bus companies} that run in Aylesbury. Most are singly operated and they also have 3 female drivers.
